title: At the US Supreme Court, debates over Trump's immunity push back the prospect of a trial
summary: On Thursday, the justices considered the former president's request for full immunity. By seeking to define the scope of any partial immunity, they are paving the way for further appeals that could last beyond the presidential election.

title: UNRWA wins back support from some donor countries following independent review
summary: Germany, one of the main donors to the UN agency in charge of Palestinian refugees, has announced the resumption of its payments. Others may follow. These funds were frozen at the end of January after Israel accused the organization of being infiltrated by Hamas.

title: Ireland's asylum-seeker rise shows UK Rwanda plan having impact, claims Sunak
summary: The British prime minister said in a television interview that the influx of migrants into Ireland is because his Rwanda plan is working as a deterrent.

title: England clinch third successive Women's Six Nations Grand Slam
summary: The Red Roses sealed a third consecutive Six Nations Grand Slam and fifth straight title with a victory over France in Bordeaux.

title: 'Mammoth task' awaits Haiti's newly installed transition council
summary: The nine members of the temporary governing body were sworn in, while Prime Minister Ariel Henry resigned. The new leaders will have to resolve the serious security crisis, in order to hand over power to an elected government by February 2026.

title: Sabine Azéma: 'I've always felt like a sheep that's escaped from the herd'
summary: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The actress, who has won two César awards for Best Actress, talks about the origin of her eternal joie de vivre.

title: Influential Iraqi cleric Moqtada Sadr backs US campus protests for Gaza
summary: As the death toll mounts in Gaza, protesters at universities across the country are demanding schools cut financial ties to Israel.

title: Climate change and the environment take a back seat in Emmanuel Macron's speech on Europe
summary: On Thursday, the French president integrated climate concerns with other challenges, including energy, competitiveness, and production.

title: In Paris, Sciences Po students end Gaza war protests after street fight
summary: University authorities agreed to drop all disciplinary proceedings against demonstrators.

title: Police detain 100 as pro-Palestinian camp cleared at Boston university
summary: The action was taken on Saturday after some protesters resorted to 'virulent anti-Semitic slurs, including Kill the Jews,' Northeastern University said on social media.

title: 'Giving a voice to people in precarious situations was the tool I needed to rebuild my life'
summary: This 52-year-old woman spent a year on the streets to escape an abusive husband. She overcame this challenging period by getting involved in civic matters.

title: Gaza 'Freedom Flotilla' delayed in Turkey
summary: 'Guinea-Bissau has allowed itself to become complicit in Israel's deliberate starvation, illegal siege and genocide of Palestinians in Gaza,' the Freedom Flotilla Coalition said, after two of their boats were blocked in Turkey on Saturday.

title: In Burkina Faso, 'soldiers wanted to make sure there were no survivors'
summary: According to Human Rights Watch, over 200 civilians were killed at the end of February in the north of the country. It was another massacre blamed on an army unable to contain the jihadist insurgency.

title: The 'boy mom,' the mother who cannot cut the cord with her son
summary: Anne Chirol reports on the digital archetypes of our time, from the #tradwife to the #fuckboy. This week, the mother who wants to be eternally connected with her son, to whom she is devoted.

title: Moody's and Fitch keep France's ratings unchanged
summary: Fitch, which downgraded France's credit rating last year, left it at AA− on Friday evening. Moody's maintained the rating at Aa2, one notch above Fitch, but said it's 'unlikely' that France will hit its deficit target.

title: Near Paris, a pediatric clinic treats young children for 'excessive' screen use
summary: Concerned parents come to pediatrician Sylvie Dieu Osika for help, such as when an child doesn't speak or look people in the eye. When her practice was launched in 2019, the target age was before 11. Now, it has dropped to below 3.

title: In Canada, British Columbia will make changes to its drug decriminalization policy
summary: The province is asking the federal government to make illicit drug use illegal in all public spaces, including inside hospitals, on transit, and in parks.

title: A wave of hostility against Syrian refugees in Lebanon
summary: Dozens of calls for deportation were issued in the country after the murder of a Christian political leader, blamed by the army on a 'Syrian gang.'

title: Gaza war casts shadow over White House correspondents' dinner
summary: Protesters deployed a huge Palestinian flag on the hotel where the dinner was held.
